page.title: 08A MIXED FARM IN APE_DALE
page.content: This is a fairly typical mixed{family} {farm,}the 260 acres are divided between corn,grazing and silage for the dairy herd.This consists of 100 Fresian cows and 2 bulls(1Hereford,& 1Charolais).The calves are sold at one week old and replacements are bought and reared on the farm.There is also a flock of 50 breeding ewes.In addition to the owner,his 2 sons and 1 cowman staff the farm,which lies at the foot of{Wenlock Edge}in a limestone valley. This tends to mean a heavy type soil and much capital has been spent on draining the land.Powerful equipment is needed and 4-wheeltractors are essential.To ensure a good yield the sowing has to be done in the Autumn. Very often it is impossible to {work {the land}in Spring.Thus as soon as the corn is harvested,ploughing cmmences.
